intro: Cryptantha torreyana var. incana, commonly known as the woolly cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy, silver-gray foliage. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in coastal and inland areas. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it a notable species in its native range.
